channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Natural Gas Rises on West Coast Heat, Storm Watches
item.description: Natural gas was up 0.5% with heat in the West expected to drive up demand for air conditioning and three tropical systems active in the Atlantic Ocean...

item.title: Darden Restaurants earnings disappoint as Olive Garden, fine dining sales struggle
item.description: Olive Garden parent Darden Restaurants reported weaker-than-expected earnings and revenue for its fiscal first quarter.

item.title: Stellantis and Aston Martin shares drop sharply after profit warnings amid China woes
item.description: Stocks of European carmakers hemorrhaged early on Monday as Stellantis and British luxury brand Aston Martin issued profit warnings.

item.title: We ranked the latest earnings reports from 30 portfolio stocks from great to ugly
item.description: Our companies' performances were reflective of the S&P 500 firms in aggregate.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Mixed as China Stocks Enjoy Best Day Since 2008
item.description: The S&P 500 and Dow industrials inched lower, after the Dow closed at a record high on Friday. The Nasdaq Composite ticked up.

item.title: The $1,000 'Micro' Handbags Luxury Brands Are Pinning Their Hopes On
item.description: To spot a potential comeback story in the luxury goods industry, look for the brand with the smallest handbags.

item.title: We're upping our price target on Costco after another steady quarter fortifies our thesis
item.description: The retailer's fourth-quarter results were mixed, but we have more conviction in Costco's appeal to shoppers.

item.title: How Nvidia's Monster Rally Broke Your Tech ETF
item.description: With several $3 trillion companies in a single sector, S&P was forced to change its index-weighting rules.

item.title: H&M shares fall as much as 8% on profit miss and scrapped earnings margin target
item.description: Shares of H&M tumbled as much as 8% on Thursday after the world's second-largest listed fashion retailer posted a miss on operating profit.

item.title: Euro's Strength Might Lose Momentum Until Next Year
item.description: The euro is unlikely to rise much further against the dollar in the near term as expectations for Fed and ECB interest-rate cuts are fully priced for ...
